etymology.description: semantic 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic 敖(敖) (áo, "ramble") = associated with speech or vocalization
etymology.interpretation: The character 謷(謷) uses 言(言) (yán, "speech") to indicate its connection to speaking or making sounds, while 敖(敖) (áo, "ramble") serves as the phonetic component, suggesting how the character would be pronounced. The construction aligns with the meaning related to audible expressions or speech.
